intro: Galphimia gracilis, commonly known as the slender galphimia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically bright red or orange, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing as a shrub or small tree. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in warm climates.
